summary: Collect metrics about coverage and performance of whole genome sequencing (WGS) experiments.

arguments.summary: Allele fraction for which to calculate theoretical sensitivity.
arguments.name: --ALLELE_FRACTION

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: If true, count unpaired reads, and paired reads with one end unmapped
arguments.name: --COUNT_UNPAIRED

arguments.summary: Treat positions with coverage exceeding this value as if they had coverage at this value (but calculate the difference for PCT_EXC_CAPPED).
arguments.name: --COVERAGE_CAP

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: Determines whether to include the base quality histogram in the metrics file.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_BQ_HISTOGRAM

arguments.summary: Input SAM or BAM file.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: An interval list file that contains the positions to restrict the assessment. Please note that all bases of reads that overlap these intervals will be considered, even if some of those bases extend beyond the boundaries of the interval. The ideal use case for this argument is to use it to restrict the calculation to a subset of (whole) contigs.
arguments.name: --INTERVALS

arguments.summary: At positions with coverage exceeding this value, completely ignore reads that accumulate beyond this value (so that they will not be considered for PCT_EXC_CAPPED).  Used to keep memory consumption in check, but could create bias if set too low
arguments.name: --LOCUS_ACCUMULATION_CAP

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Minimum base quality for a base to contribute coverage. N bases will be treated as having a base quality of negative infinity and will therefore be excluded from coverage regardless of the value of this parameter.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_BASE_QUALITY

arguments.summary: Minimum mapping quality for a read to contribute coverage.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_MAPPING_QUALITY

arguments.summary: Output metrics file.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Average read length in the file. Default is 150.
arguments.name: --READ_LENGTH

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: Sample Size used for Theoretical Het Sensitivity sampling. Default is 10000.
arguments.name: --SAMPLE_SIZE

arguments.summary: For debugging purposes, stop after processing this many genomic bases.
arguments.name: --STOP_AFTER

arguments.summary: Output for Theoretical Sensitivity metrics.
arguments.name: --THEORETICAL_SENSITIVITY_OUTPUT

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: If true, fast algorithm is used.
arguments.name: --USE_FAST_ALGORITHM

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

description:
Computes a number of metrics that are useful for evaluating coverage and performance of whole genome sequencing experiments.
 Two algorithms are available for this metrics: default and fast. The fast algorithm is enabled by USE_FAST_ALGORITHM option.
 The fast algorithm works better for regions of BAM file with coverage at least 10 reads per locus,
 for lower coverage the algorithms perform the same.
name: CollectWgsMetrics
